intro: Ricinocarpus tarapotensis, commonly known as the Taro tree, is a tropical plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces edible fruits that are often used in local cuisines. Its roots and stems are also utilized in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The Taro tree plays an important ecological role in its native habitats, contributing to biodiversity and soil stability.
